citation.article-title: Methanobacterium thermoalcaliphilum spec. nov., a new moderately alkaliphilic and thermophilic autotrophic methanogen.

p.s: Description of Methanobacterium thermoalcaliphilum sp. nov.

Methanobacterium thermoalcaliphilum (ther.mo.al.cal.li.phi.lum) Gr. adj. thermus hot; Arabic al the; Arabic n. galiy the ash of saltwork; M.L.n. alcali alkali; Gr. adj. philus loving, friendly; thermoalcaliphilum heat and alkali loving)
Cells occur singly or in chains.
Insensitive to antibiotics inhibiting peptidoglycan synthesis (penicillin, ampicillin and vancomycin).
Colony characteristics: Circular, pale yellow in colour with entire edges.
DNA base composition: 38.8 mol% G + C.
Physiology: Obligately anaerobic; only H2 + CO2 serve as substrates for growth and methanogenesis.
Nutrition: Growth autotrophically in defined mineral medium and H2 + CO2 with the addition of yeast extract; elevated NaCl not required.
Source: Biogas digestor of cattle manure.
Type strain: AC60 has been deposited in the German culture collection (DSM), Göttingen, FRG, number 3267.
